Module org.example.miniproyecto_3
Package org.example.miniproyecto_3.Controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
org.example.miniproyecto_3.Controller.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
Controller class for the main game screen in the Battleship game.

Manages user interaction, game logic integration, grid rendering, drag-and-drop ship placement, and turn-based gameplay.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes controller dependencies after FXML injection. Instantiates file handlers used throughout the controller.

    • setUpController

      public void setUpController()
      Configures the controller based on whether the game should load a saved state or start a new one. Initializes game data, boards, and UI.

    • handleLabels

      public void handleLabels()
      Reads the player's nickname from file, sets initial score, and updates label elements for display.

    • handleButtons

      public void handleButtons()
      Sets up event handlers for all primary buttons.

    • handleSaveButton

      public void handleSaveButton()
      Sets the action for the "Save" button to persist the current game state.

    • handleRestartButton

      public void handleRestartButton()
      Sets the action for the "Restart" button to reload the game view and reset the controller to a new game state.

    • handlePlayButton

      public void handlePlayButton()
      Sets the action for the "Play" button to validate board setup and transition to gameplay mode.

    • setPlayState

      public void setPlayState() throws IncompleteBoard
      Transitions the game to play mode: Validates ship placement, initializes boards with clickable cells, assigns events to handle player shots and machine turn logic.
      Throws:
      IncompleteBoard - if the player hasn't placed all ships.

    • drawInitialShips

      public void drawInitialShips()
      Draws the player's ships of different sizes and adds them to the corresponding ship stacks. Also sets up drag and rotate behavior for each ship.

    • handleShipMovement

      public void handleShipMovement(Ship ship, StackPane stack, Pane pane)
      Assigns the drag-and-drop behavior and placement validation to a ship. Allows rotation with right-click and removes the ship from the board when picked up.
      Parameters:
      ship - the Ship object being moved
      stack - the original stack the ship was placed in
      pane - the visual representation of the ship as a Pane

    • machineTurn

      private void machineTurn()
      Simulates the machine's turn in the game. After a short delay to mimic thinking time, the machine selects a target on the player's board and fires at it. If the shot is a hit and the game is not over, the machine shoots again. Automatically saves the game state after each move.

    • shootCell

      private void shootCell(Coordinate target, Board board, ArrayList<ArrayList<StackPane>> stackPanes, Pane[][] panePositions)
      Executes a shot on the specified target coordinate of a given board. Updates the UI based on the result of the shot (hit, miss, or sunk), manages score updates, end-game condition, and saves the game state.
      Parameters:
      target - the coordinate to fire at
      board - the board (player or machine) being targeted
      stackPanes - the stack pane matrix representing the visual grid
      panePositions - the pane matrix containing ship visuals for interaction

    • saveGame

      private void saveGame()
      Saves the current game state using both a serializable binary format and a plain text file. The plain text file stores the player's nickname and score for quick access.

    • loadGameState

      private void loadGameState()
      Loads a previously saved game from file. If successful, restores the player's and machine's boards, updates the visual components, and resumes play state. If loading fails, starts a new game and displays an error message.

    • placeShips

      private void placeShips(Board board, ArrayList<Pane> paneList, GridPane gridPane, Pane[][] panesPositions)
      Places the ships visually on the grid pane by creating pane representations and aligning them based on the model Ships orientation and coordinates.
      Parameters:
      board - the board containing the ships to place
      paneList - the list that will hold the ship panes
      gridPane - the grid pane where ships are to be displayed
      panesPositions - the matrix storing the position of each ship pane

    • handleViewButton

      private void handleViewButton()
      Sets up the event handler for the view button, allowing the player to toggle the visibility of the enemy ships. If the player hasn't placed their ships, it shows an error message.

    • viewEnemyShips

      private void viewEnemyShips()
      Makes all enemy ship panes visible on the machine's grid. Used for debugging when the player chooses to reveal the enemy ships.

    • hideEnemyShips

      private void hideEnemyShips()
      Hides all enemy ship panes from view on the machine's grid. This is used to conceal the enemy ships again after being shown.

    • showError

      public void showError(Label label, String message)
      Displays an error message using a fading label animation. The message fades in, stays visible for a short time, then fades out.
      Parameters:
      label - the label to display the message on
      message - the error message to show

    • showTempMessage

      public void showTempMessage(Label label, String tempMessage, String defaultMessage, double seconds)
      Temporarily displays a message in the given label for a specified duration, then reverts to the default message.
      Parameters:
      label - the Label to update
      tempMessage - the temporary message to show
      defaultMessage - the message to revert back to after the delay
      seconds - how long (in seconds) to display the temporary message

    • drawShip

      public Pane drawShip(int length)
      Creates a Pane representing a ship of the specified length.
      Parameters:
      length - the length of the ship (1 to 4)
      Returns:
      a Pane visually representing the ship; an empty Pane if length is invalid

    • flipShip

      public void flipShip(Ship ship, Pane pane)
      Flips the orientation of the given ship and rotates its visual pane accordingly.
      Parameters:
      ship - the Ship object to flip orientation
      pane - the Pane representing the ship that will be rotated

    • showEndScreen

      public void showEndScreen(boolean playerWon)
      Displays the end game screen, indicating whether the player has won or lost.
      Parameters:
      playerWon - true if the player won the game, false otherwise

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard(Board board, ArrayList<ArrayList<StackPane>> stackPanes, Pane[][] panePositions)
      Updates the visual representation of the entire board based on cell states.
      Parameters:
      board - the Board to update
      stackPanes - the nested list of StackPanes representing the board cells
      panePositions - the matrix of Panes representing ship positions

    • formatShotCell

      public void formatShotCell(Cell cell, ArrayList<ArrayList<StackPane>> stackPanes, Pane[][] panePositions)
      Formats a single cell's visual representation based on its state (HIT or MISS). If a ship is sunk it makes it visible and marks the whole ship with skull icons.
      Parameters:
      cell - the Cell to format
      stackPanes - the nested list of StackPanes representing the board cells
      panePositions - the matrix of Panes representing ship positions

    • setContinueGame

      public void setContinueGame(Boolean continueGame)
      Sets the flag indicating whether the current game session should continue.
      Parameters:
      continueGame - true to continue the game, false otherwise
